comments: Partial sums of A006495. - _Paul Barry_, Mar 16 2006This is the Lucas U(P=2,Q=5) sequence. - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 24 2012With different signs, 0, 1, -2, -1, 12, -19, -22, 139, -168, -359, 1558,.. we obtain the Lucas U(-2,5) sequence. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 08 2013

Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (2,-5).
formula: Contribution from _Paul Barry_, Sep 20 2003: (Start)G.f.: x/(1-2x+5x^2);E.g.f.: exp(x)sin(2x)/2;a(n) = 2*a(n-1)-5*a(n-2), a(0)=0, a(1)=1;a(n) = ((1+2i)^n-(1-2i)^n)/(4i), where i=sqrt(-1);a(n) = Im{(1+2i)^n/2};a(n) = sum{k=0..floor(n/2), C(n, 2k+1)(-4)^k}. (End)a(n+1) = sum{k=0..n, C(k,n-k)2^k*(-5/2)^(n-k)}. - _Paul Barry_, Mar 16 2006G.f.: 1/(4*x - 1/G(0)) where G(k) =  1 - (k+1)/(1 - x/(x - (k+1)/G(k+1) )); (recursively defined continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Dec 06 2012G.f.: Q(0)*x/2, where Q(k) = 1 + 1/(1 - x*(4*k+2 - 5*x)/( x*(4*k+4 - 5*x) + 1/Q(k+1) )); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Aug 30 2013
